author: Rockford Register Star
title: College Football: Hope blanks Rockford
text: Posted Oct. 10, 2015 at 6:27 PM Updated Oct 10, 2015 at 6:27 PM By Rockford Register Star Posted Oct. 10, 2015 at 6:27 PM ROCKFORD -- Hope College overwhelmed the Rockford Regents 34-0 Saturday, scoring on three of its first four possessions. Rockford's offense had just 69 yards in the first half while allowing 315 to Hope (2-3). For the game, Hope had 475 total yards and Rockford (2-3) had 261 yards. Rockford (2-3) turned the ball over twice. Hope returned an interception 95 yards for a second-half touchdown. Rockford's Mar Sean Vercher caught seven passes for 52 yards. Pete Berry rushed 14 times for 54 yards. Tremaine Berry led Rockford with 11 tackles including 3.5 tackles for loss. Reggie Haynes had eight tackles, one interception and three pass breakups. Rockford plays at Wisconsin Lutheran College next Saturday. By Rockford Register Star
